titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Hannah Benner Roach (1907-1976) was an editor, officer, and director of the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania. She was a research associate for the William Penn Papers project from 1969-1975.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes research materials and writings by Roach. Documentation includes: resource materials and drafts of Roach's work on "The Planting of Philadelphia," an article published in PMHB; various William Penn items, including a talk on him from 1972, reports of the Papers of project, 1969-1974, copies of William Penn papers, and notes on Penn; a typed copy of Skippack Deaths; information on where tax lists are located in Philadelphia; transcriptions of 18th century tax lists, mostly for Elfreth's Alley (Mulberry Ward); and an annotated typescript for An Account of Elfreth's Alley and Its People from the Earliest Times. This manuscript was originally copyrighted in 1958, and (re?)published in 1995; there is a small amount of correspondence related to the latter publication.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
